Make Interpretation of ATE Results

Source: R/margot_plot.R
margot_interpret_marginal.Rd

Interpretation helper that reports estimates on both transformed and original scales, with optional family-wise-error rate adjustment notes for confidence intervals and E-values.

Usage

margot_interpret_marginal(
  df,
  type = c("RD", "RR"),
  order = c("alphabetical", "magnitude_desc", "magnitude_asc", "evaluebound_desc",
    "evaluebound_asc", "custom", "default"),
  original_df = NULL,
  e_val_bound_threshold = 1,
  adjust = c("none", "bonferroni", "holm"),
  alpha = 0.05
)

Arguments

df

Data frame containing the variables to interpret.

type

Character; one of "RD" or "RR". Default: "RD".

order

Character; sorting option for outcomes. See `margot_plot` for details.

original_df

Data frame; if provided, back-transformed estimates will be included.

e_val_bound_threshold

Numeric; minimum E-Value bound to treat an effect as reliable. Default: 1.

adjust

Character; multiple comparison adjustment method: one of "none", "bonferroni", or "holm". Default: "none".

alpha

Numeric; significance level for adjustments. Default: 0.05. Used when `adjust` is "bonferroni" or "holm".

Value

A list with: * `interpretation`: markdown string including any adjustment notes and reliable outcomes.
